problem.markdown:
1. In a beam of uniform strength, the bending stress developed is constant and is equal to the allowable stress at every section of the beam. (True or False)
(x) True () False
2. Bending stress is the tensile or compressive stress resulting from the application of a non-axial forces
() True (x) False
3. According to bending theory which of the following statement is wrong?
() Strain is directly proportional to the distance from the neutral axis. (x) At the neutral axis of a beam, the bending stress is maximum. () The plane sections before bending remains plane after bending () The bending stress in a beam is inversely proportional to the section modulus
4. In a simple bending theory, one of the assumption is that the material of the beam is isotropic. This assumption means that the
() Normal stress remains constant in all directions (x) Elastic constants are same in all the directions () Normal stress varies linearly in the material () Elastic constants varies linearly in the material
5. Bending stress is the tensile or compressive stress resulting from the application of a non-axial forces
() True (x) False
